results.title: Beneficient reprobate: ethyl alcohol, its nature and properties
results.creator_credit: Burton Holmes Films and Elmer Clifton
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Women’s Christian Temperance Union, this film deals with the industrial uses of alcohol, and the effects of alcohol on the central nervous system of the human body. Produced from Bertha Rachel Palmer’s “A Syllabus in Alcohol Education”.

results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Nihon Hoso Kyokai, UNICEF and Peter Pastorelle
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Bob Scarfe
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Bending and reflecting sunlight
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Warren Brown
results.brief_description: Three boys, experimenting with everyday objects, discover the phenomena of refraction and reflection. Playing with a magnifying glass, a water-filled jar, and hose spray, they begin to grasp the principles of magnification, bent images, and rainbows, as they see light interacting with various materials. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bendigo pottery
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Trevor Lunn and Brendan Kenworthy
results.brief_description: This program gives some insight into the process involved in making pottery and shows some of the types of clay used, the preparation, pot throwing and glazing at the Bendigo pottery.

results.title: Ben et Benedict = Ben and Benedict
results.brief_description:
Ben is a woman who never gets to do what she really wants to and is the victim of everybody and everything. Benedict is her imaginary creation: the girl who would respond with strength and mastery to situations Ben can only submit to. She is married to a cad who says he only married her because she was pregnant, and now he wants his freedom. Her real love is a fellow medical student who shows some interest in her. Nonetheless, she remains faithful to her unenthusiastic husband, until she becomes pregnant again. At this point she begins to act more like the Benedict of her dreams and less like the Ben she has lived as until now.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Paula Delsol ; writer, Paula Delsol ; photography, Claude Beausoleil ; music, Larry Martin ; title song, Pierre Barouh.
Cast: Francoise Lebrun, Andre Dussolier, Daniel Duval, Francois Perrier [voice only], Jacques Jeannet.

results.title: Beluga baby
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Christopher Pinney, John Taylor and Tony Westman
results.brief_description: The birth of a beluga whale is a seldom witnessed event. This is a record of the birth of a whale in the Vancouver Aquarium, the excitement building up to it, the labor, and the sudden and inexplicable death of the baby. Awards: Rio de Janeiro; Missoula.
